task.title: Vegan French Toast
task.shortdesc: If you're feeling fancy and have a little more time, this recipe is for you! The nutritional yeast added to the recipe mimics the texture and flavor of the eggs that are normally used.

taskbody.prereq:
Make sure you have all the ingredients. You'll need:
6 slices day-old ciabatta bread, sliced about 3/4 inch thick
1 cup almond milk
1 tablespoon maple syrup, plus more for serving
2 tablespoons millet flour
1 tablespoon nutritional yeast
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg
pinch of salt
coconut oil
You'll need these for toppings:
powdered sugar
vegan butter
maple syrup
fresh fruit

step.cmd: Whisk the almond milk, maple syrup, flour, nutritional yeast, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt in a small bowl
Place all of the ciabatta bread in a shallow dish.
Pour the mixture over the ciabatta bread.

substep.cmd: Make sure to flip or lift the ciabatta bread to make sure each side is evenly coated.

step.cmd: Heat a drizzle of coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. When the pan is hot,
add the ciabatta bread slices and cook for a few minutes per side, until golden brown.
Serve with powdered sugar, a dab of vegan butter, maple syrup, and fresh fruit.
